00003 /***************************************************************************/
00004 /* RSC IDENTIFIER: MOLLWEIDE
00005  *
00006  * ABSTRACT
00007  *
00008  *    This component provides conversions between Geodetic coordinates
00009  *    (latitude and longitude in radians) and Mollweide projection coordinates
00010  *    (easting and northing in meters).  The Mollweide Pseudocylindrical
00011  *    projection employs a spherical Earth model.  The Spherical Radius
00012  *    used is the the radius of the sphere having the same area as the
00013  *    ellipsoid.
00014  *
00015  * ERROR HANDLING
00016  *
00017  *    This component checks parameters for valid values.  If an invalid value
00018  *    is found, the error code is combined with the current error code using 
00019  *    the bitwise or.  This combining allows multiple error codes to be
00020  *    returned. The possible error codes are:
00021  *
00022  *          MOLL_NO_ERROR           : No errors occurred in function
00023  *          MOLL_LAT_ERROR          : Latitude outside of valid range
00024  *                                      (-90 to 90 degrees)
00025  *          MOLL_LON_ERROR          : Longitude outside of valid range
00026  *                                      (-180 to 360 degrees)
00027  *          MOLL_EASTING_ERROR      : Easting outside of valid range
00028  *                                      (False_Easting +/- ~18,000,000 m,
00029  *                                       depending on ellipsoid parameters)
00030  *          MOLL_NORTHING_ERROR     : Northing outside of valid range
00031  *                                      (False_Northing +/- ~9,000,000 m,
00032  *                                       depending on ellipsoid parameters)
00033  *          MOLL_ORIGIN_LON_ERROR   : Origin longitude outside of valid range
00034  *                                      (-180 to 360 degrees)
00035  *          MOLL_A_ERROR            : Semi-major axis less than or equal to zero
00036  *          MOLL_INV_F_ERROR        : Inverse flattening outside of valid range
00037  *                                                                                        (250 to 350)
00038  *
00039  * REUSE NOTES
00040  *
00041  *    MOLLWEID is intended for reuse by any application that performs a
00042  *    Mollweide projection or its inverse.
00043  *
00044  * REFERENCES
00045  *
00046  *    Further information on MOLLWEID can be found in the Reuse Manual.
00047  *
00048  *    MOLLWEID originated from :  U.S. Army Topographic Engineering Center
00049  *                                Geospatial Information Division
00050  *                                7701 Telegraph Road
00051  *                                Alexandria, VA  22310-3864
00052  *
00053  * LICENSES
00054  *
00055  *    None apply to this component.
00056  *
00057  * RESTRICTIONS
00058  *
00059  *    MOLLWEID has no restrictions.
00060  *
00061  * ENVIRONMENT
00062  *
00063  *    MOLLWEID was tested and certified in the following environments:
00064  *
00065  *    1. Solaris 2.5 with GCC 2.8.1
00066  *    2. Windows 95 with MS Visual C++ 6
00067  *
00068  * MODIFICATIONS
00069  *
00070  *    Date              Description
00071  *    ----              -----------
00072  *    04-16-99          Original Code
00073  *    03-05-07          Original C++ Code
00074  *
00075  */
00076 
00077

00080  *                               INCLUDES
00081  */

00095  *    GeodeticCoordinates.h   - defines geodetic coordinates
00096  *    CoordinateConversionException.h - Exception handler
00097  *    ErrorMessages.h  - Contains exception messages
00098  */
00099

00108 
00109 const double PI = 3.14159265358979323e0;      /* PI                     */
00110 const double PI_OVER_2 = ( PI / 2.0);                 
00111 const double MAX_LAT = ( (PI * 90) / 180.0 ); /* 90 degrees in radians  */
00112 const double TWO_PI = (2.0 * PI);                  
00113

00115 /************************************************************************/
00116 /*                              FUNCTIONS     
00117  *
00118  */
00119 
00120 Mollweide::Mollweide( double ellipsoidSemiMajorAxis, double ellipsoidFlattening, double centralMeridian, double falseEasting, double falseNorthing ) :
00121   CoordinateSystem(),
00122   es2( 0.0066943799901413800 ),
00123   es4( 4.4814723452405e-005 ),
00124   es6( 3.0000678794350e-007 ),
00125   Sqrt2_Ra( 9009964.7614632 ),
00126   Sqrt8_Ra( 18019929.522926 ),
00127   Moll_Origin_Long( 0.0 ),
00128   Moll_False_Easting( 0.0 ),
00129   Moll_False_Northing( 0.0 ),
00130   Moll_Delta_Northing( 9009965.0 ),
00131   Moll_Max_Easting( 18019930.0 ),
00132   Moll_Min_Easting( -18019930.0 )
00133 {
00134 /*
00135  * The constructor receives the ellipsoid parameters and
00136  * Mollweide projcetion parameters as inputs, and sets the corresponding state
00137  * variables.  If any errors occur, an exception is thrown with a description 
00138  * of the error.
00139  *
00140  *    ellipsoidSemiMajorAxis  : Semi-major axis of ellipsoid, in meters   (input)
00141  *    ellipsoidFlattening     : Flattening of ellipsoid                                                 (input)
00142  *    centralMeridian         : Longitude in radians at the center of     (input)
00143  *                              the projection
00144  *    falseEasting            : A coordinate value in meters assigned to the
00145  *                              central meridian of the projection.       (input)
00146  *    falseNorthing           : A coordinate value in meters assigned to the
00147  *                              origin latitude of the projection         (input)
00148  */
00149 
00150   double Ra;                       /* Spherical Radius */
00151   double inv_f = 1 / ellipsoidFlattening;
00152   char errorStatus[500] = "";
00153 
00154   if (ellipsoidSemiMajorAxis <= 0.0)
00155   { /* Semi-major axis must be greater than zero */
00156     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::semiMajorAxis );
00157   }
00158   if ((inv_f < 250) || (inv_f > 350))
00159   { /* Inverse flattening must be between 250 and 350 */
00160     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::ellipsoidFlattening );
00161   }
00162   if ((centralMeridian < -PI) || (centralMeridian > TWO_PI))
00163   { /* origin longitude out of range */
00164     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::centralMeridian );
00165   }
00166 
00167   if( strlen( errorStatus ) > 0)
00168     throw CoordinateConversionException( errorStatus );
00169 
00170   semiMajorAxis = ellipsoidSemiMajorAxis;
00171   flattening = ellipsoidFlattening;
00172 
00173   es2 = 2 * flattening - flattening * flattening;
00174   es4 = es2 * es2;
00175   es6 = es4 * es2;
00176   /* spherical radius */
00177   Ra = semiMajorAxis * (1.0 - es2 / 6.0 - 17.0 * es4 / 360.0 - 67.0 * es6 / 3024.0);
00178   Sqrt2_Ra = sqrt(2.0) * Ra;
00179   Sqrt8_Ra = sqrt(8.0) * Ra;
00180   if (centralMeridian > PI)
00181     centralMeridian -= TWO_PI;
00182   Moll_Origin_Long = centralMeridian;
00183   Moll_False_Easting = falseEasting;
00184   Moll_False_Northing = falseNorthing;
00185 
00186   if (Moll_Origin_Long > 0)
00187   {
00188     Moll_Max_Easting = 17919819.0;
00189     Moll_Min_Easting = -18019930.0;
00190   }
00191   else if (Moll_Origin_Long < 0)
00192   {
00193     Moll_Max_Easting = 18019930.0;
00194     Moll_Min_Easting = -17919819.0;
00195   }
00196   else
00197   {
00198     Moll_Max_Easting = 18019930.0;
00199     Moll_Min_Easting = -18019930.0;
00200   }
00201 }

00204 Mollweide::Mollweide( const Mollweide &m )
00205 {
00206   semiMajorAxis = m.semiMajorAxis;
00207   flattening = m.flattening;
00208   es2 = m.es2;
00209   es4 = m.es4;
00210   es6 = m.es6;
00211   Sqrt2_Ra = m.Sqrt2_Ra;
00212   Sqrt8_Ra = m.Sqrt8_Ra;
00213   Moll_Origin_Long = m.Moll_Origin_Long;
00214   Moll_False_Easting = m.Moll_False_Easting;
00215   Moll_False_Northing = m.Moll_False_Northing;
00216   Moll_Delta_Northing = m.Moll_Delta_Northing;
00217   Moll_Max_Easting = m.Moll_Max_Easting;
00218   Moll_Min_Easting = m.Moll_Min_Easting;
00219 }

00227 Mollweide& Mollweide::operator=( const Mollweide &m )
00228 {
00229   if( this != &m )
00230   {
00231     semiMajorAxis = m.semiMajorAxis;
00232     flattening = m.flattening;
00233     es2 = m.es2;
00234     es4 = m.es4;
00235     es6 = m.es6;
00236     Sqrt2_Ra = m.Sqrt2_Ra;
00237     Sqrt8_Ra = m.Sqrt8_Ra;
00238     Moll_Origin_Long = m.Moll_Origin_Long;
00239     Moll_False_Easting = m.Moll_False_Easting;
00240     Moll_False_Northing = m.Moll_False_Northing;
00241     Moll_Delta_Northing = m.Moll_Delta_Northing;
00242     Moll_Max_Easting = m.Moll_Max_Easting;
00243     Moll_Min_Easting = m.Moll_Min_Easting;
00244   }
00245 
00246   return *this;
00247 }

00250 MapProjection3Parameters* Mollweide::getParameters() const
00251 {
00252 /*
00253  * The function getParameters returns the current ellipsoid
00254  * parameters and Mollweide projection parameters.
00255  *
00256  *    ellipsoidSemiMajorAxis  : Semi-major axis of ellipsoid, in meters   (output)
00257  *    ellipsoidFlattening     : Flattening of ellipsoid                                                 (output)
00258  *    centralMeridian         : Longitude in radians at the center of     (output)
00259  *                              the projection
00260  *    falseEasting            : A coordinate value in meters assigned to the
00261  *                              central meridian of the projection.       (output)
00262  *    falseNorthing           : A coordinate value in meters assigned to the
00263  *                              origin latitude of the projection         (output)
00264  */
00265 
00266   return new MapProjection3Parameters( CoordinateType::mollweide, Moll_Origin_Long, Moll_False_Easting, Moll_False_Northing );
00267 }
00268 
00269 
00270 MSP::CCS::MapProjectionCoordinates* Mollweide::convertFromGeodetic( MSP::CCS::GeodeticCoordinates* geodeticCoordinates )
00271 {
00272 /*
00273  * The function convertFromGeodetic converts geodetic (latitude and
00274  * longitude) coordinates to Mollweide projection (easting and northing)
00275  * coordinates, according to the current ellipsoid and Mollweide projection
00276  * parameters.  If any errors occur, an exception is thrown with a description 
00277  * of the error.
00278  *
00279  *    longitude         : Longitude (lambda) in radians       (input)
00280  *    latitude          : Latitude (phi) in radians           (input)
00281  *    easting           : Easting (X) in meters               (output)
00282  *    northing          : Northing (Y) in meters              (output)
00283  */
00284 
00285   double dlam;                                  /* Longitude - Central Meridan */
00286   double theta;
00287   double delta_theta_primed = 0.1745329;        /* arbitrarily initialized to 10 deg */
00288   double dtp_tolerance = 4.85e-10;              /* approximately 1/1000th of
00289                                                  an arc second or 1/10th meter */
00290   int count = 60;
00291   char errorStatus[50] = "";
00292 
00293   double longitude = geodeticCoordinates->longitude();
00294   double latitude = geodeticCoordinates->latitude();
00295   double PI_Sin_Latitude = PI * sin(latitude);
00296   double theta_primed = latitude;
00297 
00298   if ((latitude < -PI_OVER_2) || (latitude > PI_OVER_2))
00299   {  /* Latitude out of range */
00300     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::latitude );
00301   }
00302   if ((longitude < -PI) || (longitude > TWO_PI))
00303   {  /* Longitude out of range */
00304     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::longitude );
00305   }
00306 
00307   if( strlen( errorStatus ) > 0)
00308     throw CoordinateConversionException( errorStatus );
00309 
00310   dlam = longitude - Moll_Origin_Long;
00311   if (dlam > PI)
00312   {
00313     dlam -= TWO_PI;
00314   }
00315   if (dlam < -PI)
00316   {
00317     dlam += TWO_PI;
00318   }
00319   while (fabs(delta_theta_primed) > dtp_tolerance && count)
00320   {
00321     delta_theta_primed = -(theta_primed + sin(theta_primed) -
00322                            PI_Sin_Latitude) / (1.0 + cos(theta_primed));
00323     theta_primed += delta_theta_primed;
00324     count --;
00325   }
00326 
00327   if(!count)
00328     throw CoordinateConversionException( ErrorMessages::northing );
00329 
00330   theta = theta_primed / 2.0;
00331   double easting = (Sqrt8_Ra / PI ) * dlam * cos(theta) +
00332              Moll_False_Easting;
00333   double northing = Sqrt2_Ra * sin(theta) + Moll_False_Northing;
00334 
00335   return new MapProjectionCoordinates( CoordinateType::mollweide, easting, northing );
00336 }
00337 
00338 
00339 MSP::CCS::GeodeticCoordinates* Mollweide::convertToGeodetic( MSP::CCS::MapProjectionCoordinates* mapProjectionCoordinates )
00340 {
00341 /*
00342  * The function convertToGeodetic converts Mollweide projection
00343  * (easting and northing) coordinates to geodetic (latitude and longitude)
00344  * coordinates, according to the current ellipsoid and Mollweide projection
00345  * coordinates.  If any errors occur, an exception is thrown with a description 
00346  * of the error.
00347  *
00348  *    easting           : Easting (X) in meters                  (input)
00349  *    northing          : Northing (Y) in meters                 (input)
00350  *    longitude         : Longitude (lambda) in radians          (output)
00351  *    latitude          : Latitude (phi) in radians              (output)
00352  */
00353 
00354   double dx, dy;
00355   double theta = 0.0;
00356   double two_theta;
00357   double i;
00358   double longitude, latitude;
00359   char errorStatus[50] = "";
00360 
00361   double easting = mapProjectionCoordinates->easting();
00362   double northing = mapProjectionCoordinates->northing();
00363 
00364   if ((easting < (Moll_False_Easting + Moll_Min_Easting))
00365       || (easting > (Moll_False_Easting + Moll_Max_Easting)))
00366   { /* Easting out of range  */
00367     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::easting );
00368   }
00369   if ((northing < (Moll_False_Northing - Moll_Delta_Northing)) || 
00370       (northing >(Moll_False_Northing + Moll_Delta_Northing) ))
00371   { /* Northing out of range */
00372     strcat( errorStatus, ErrorMessages::northing );
00373   }
00374 
00375   if( strlen( errorStatus ) > 0)
00376     throw CoordinateConversionException( errorStatus );
00377 
00378   dy = northing - Moll_False_Northing;
00379   dx = easting - Moll_False_Easting;
00380   i = dy / Sqrt2_Ra;
00381   if (fabs(i) > 1.0)
00382   {
00383     latitude = MAX_LAT;
00384     if (northing < 0.0)
00385       latitude *= -1.0;
00386   }
00387 
00388   else
00389   {
00390     theta = asin(i);
00391     two_theta = 2.0 * theta;
00392     latitude = asin((two_theta + sin(two_theta)) / PI);
00393 
00394     if (latitude > PI_OVER_2)  /* force distorted values to 90, -90 degrees */
00395       latitude = PI_OVER_2;
00396     else if (latitude < -PI_OVER_2)
00397       latitude = -PI_OVER_2;
00398 
00399   }
00400   if (fabs(fabs(latitude) - MAX_LAT) < 1.0e-10)
00401     longitude = Moll_Origin_Long;
00402   else
00403     longitude = Moll_Origin_Long + PI * dx /
00404                  (Sqrt8_Ra * cos(theta));
00405 
00406   if (longitude > PI)
00407     longitude -= TWO_PI;
00408   if (longitude < -PI)
00409     longitude += TWO_PI;
00410 
00411   if (longitude > PI)  /* force distorted values to 180, -180 degrees */
00412     longitude = PI;
00413   else if (longitude < -PI)
00414     longitude = -PI;
00415 
00416   return new GeodeticCoordinates( CoordinateType::geodetic, longitude, latitude );
00417 }
